Package org.opengrok.indexer.analysis

Class JFlexTokenizer

java.lang.Object
org.apache.lucene.util.AttributeSource
org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
org.apache.lucene.analysis.Tokenizer
org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.JFlexTokenizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, SymbolMatchedListener
public class JFlexTokenizer extends org.apache.lucene.analysis.Tokenizer implements SymbolMatchedListener
Tokenizer which uses lex to identify tokens. Created on August 24, 2009
Author:
Lubos Kosco

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset() throws IOException
      Resets the instance and the instance's ScanningSymbolMatcher. If necessary, users should have first called this instance's Tokenizer.setReader(java.io.Reader) since the matcher will be reset to the current reader.
      Overrides:
      reset in class org.apache.lucene.analysis.Tokenizer
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of I/O error

    • close

      Specified by:

      Overrides:

      Throws:

    • incrementToken

      public final boolean incrementToken() throws IOException
      Attempts to advance the stream to the next acceptable token, and updates the appropriate AttributeImpls.
      Specified by:
      incrementToken in class org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
      Returns:
      true if an acceptable token was produced; false otherwise to indicate end of stream
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of I/O error

    • setAttribs

      protected void setAttribs(String str, long start, long end)
      Clears, and then resets the instances attributes per the specified arguments. If start or end is past Integer.MAX_VALUE, then only the clearing occurs.
      Parameters:
      str - the matched symbol
      start - the match start position
      end - the match end position

    • clearAttributesEtc

      protected void clearAttributesEtc()
      Calls AttributeSource.clearAttributes(), and also resets some additional tracked state.
